column1: If you are a COVID survivor and haven’t had symptoms for at 14 least days you can make a difference by donating your plasma antibodies which can help in treating critically ill COVID patients.  It’s easy to schedule an appointment. Call 877-Be-A-Hero to get started. https://t.co/xO7vpzXcam

Essential workers are not expendable. And corporations shouldn’t be given a free pass to treat workers that way by our government. That’s why I remain firmly opposed to the GOP’s demands for blanket liability for corporations to be included in the next COVID relief package. https://t.co/WOkiHSP2wl

.@GovEvers made the right decision. Wisconsin is still experiencing high COVID infection rates making it critical that we work to protect ourselves and others by wearing a mask. https://t.co/l3Vy8JjFBn
Wisconsin: we must do everything we can to fight COVID. Please wear a mask wash your hands practice social distancing and stay home whenever possible. https://t.co/AQJAOOYNCW https://t.co/kAEpvkmK2v

There are major challenges ahead but Joe Biden and Kamala Harris are hitting the ground running and have a plan to fight COVID and secure an economic recovery that uplifts the millions of Americans struggling during this pandemic. https://t.co/zOEGbupTcO

COVID cases are soaring & so is demand for COVID convalescent plasma – a new investigational therapy being used by hospitals to treat patients. If you’ve previously tested positive for COVID please consider donating your plasma. Visit https://t.co/kU2EAY1WHV.

COVID-19 cases are still spiking in Wisconsin. We need to do everything possible to fight COVID-19 by wearing a mask avoiding large gatherings and practicing social distancing. https://t.co/Cdkz7sTMQK

Joe Biden will follow the science and data to fight this pandemic which is what our country seriously needs. He is already enlisting public health leaders and scientists in a COVID-19 task force. https://t.co/8UGWdi6azU

.@SenatorBaldwin challenge accepted! ✅   I #MaskUp because it’s one of the most important things we can each do to fight COVID-19 in our communities.   I’m challenging @DavidFBowen @SenTaylor and @StateSenLaTonya to join me and #MaskUpWisconsin. https://t.co/WK2Rc3rPkP https://t.co/G7gl0W2MD2
The Trump’s administration COVID-19 strategy: sideline public health officials downplay the virus ignore CDC guidance and lie to the American people.https://t.co/xH7GsLL2LP
.@realDonaldTrump Wisconsin had to open a new *hospital* because of the record surges in COVID-19 cases.   Is that not enough for you to stay home? https://t.co/SWOi1qIPsP

.@senatemajldr has rejected COVID-19 relief legislation while rushing to confirm a SCOTUS justice.   Why? Because Republicans don’t serve you. They serve their donors.  Democrats passed a robust measure months ago to fight this pandemic and see America through this tough time. https://t.co/LgFzVs6vSp
MILWAUKEE: COVID-19 cases are skyrocketing in Wisconsin. Make sure to wear a mask when you leave the house. If you need a free mask find locations here ⬇️ https://t.co/LEO0ghmK8s
I’m speaking with @RepRobinKelly and advocates tomorrow at 6pm CT/7 pm ET to discuss ways to prevent gun violence and COVID-19's impact on this important work.   Join us ⬇️ https://t.co/xTmCNSM9H7

President Trump doesn't care about you or your family.   He is totally surrendering to COVID-19 and quitting on the millions of Americans who have lost their jobs face eviction and have to put their children to bed hungry during this recession and deadly pandemic.

Remember if you get COVID-19 you won’t be airlifted to Walter Reed and doted over by a 24/7 team of top-notch doctors and given experimental drugs...and neither will your loved ones.  Wear a mask and practice social distancing. https://t.co/38JjyAXBsp

The COVID-19 pandemic has claimed the lives of more than 206000 Americans. And we are still in the midst of this pandemic. I wish that President Trump and the First Lady make a quick recovery.   Please wear a mask and practice social distancing.

“The most prevalent topic of misinformation was ‘miracle cures’ including Mr. Trump’s promotion of anti-malarial drugs and disinfectants as potential treatments for Covid-19 the disease caused by the coronavirus.”  Irresponsible ignorant and dangerous. https://t.co/xHZorVSw3o

If he was truly on the side of the people of WI he wouldn’t hold in-person rallies that can spread COVID-19.   Once again he is prioritizing himself and his ego over people. We need leadership to bring us out of the pandemic and get folks back to work. https://t.co/00QtpNo30P

COVID-19 has reaffirmed the need to build systems of relief to reach the most vulnerable  when a crisis hits our country. That's why Senator @BrianSchatz and I introduced legislation to ensure that families have access to cash to support themselves when they need it most.

Yes the payments were meant to help workers affected by COVID. But they are also meant to help with new costs necessary because of COVID - like toilet paper soap and over-the-counter medicine that cost real money at prison commissaries.

Trump is on tape admitting he downplayed the lethality of COVID-19. Now 200000 Americans have lost their lives. Using racist phrases like the "China Virus" will never distract from his failure to lead during this crisis. He has no one to blame but himself.https://t.co/9TEJJYGWjn

200000 Americans have now died from COVID-19.  The devastation of Trump's failed leadership during this pandemic can only be understood in the needless loss of life.  These were brothers grandmas sisters fathers grandpas and mothers. We can never grow numb to this.
The Senate GOP is more concerned with filling a SCOTUS seat less than 2 months before an election than passing a COVID relief package.   Their priority isn’t the American people.

Asian Americans have faced discrimination and hateful attacks during the COVID-19 pandemic. Today I supported the passage of a resolution to condemn the mean-spirited rhetoric that has placed Asian Americans in danger and helped sow division.

That’s why I joined @SenatorBaldwin @repmarkpocan and @RepRonKind in pushing FEMA not to cut reimbursements for procuring PPE which would jeopardize Wisconsin’s access to PPE as COVID-19 cases are spiking. https://t.co/rzwKaIViU4

Like the health crisis the recession is disproportionately hurting people of color. But the Senate GOP "relief" plan cuts COVID unemployment benefits by $300 which will cause more & more people to fall behind.  The Senate GOP needs to pass the #HeroesAct.https://t.co/nZfOa6zm7t

Our federal policies must meet this moment where we face a health and economic crisis.  The Senate GOP's weak COVID package won't dig Americans out of the financial trenches. It's time for them to step up and pass the #HeroesAct now. https://t.co/9dKA2BVa41

This confirms what we already knew: he was warned about COVID in January. Instead of acting he downplayed the threat.   How many funerals have I attended?   How many Milwaukee residents have lost their jobs their homes and their lives?  This is Trump’s failure. https://t.co/Zc3SSpJwY9
More than 188000 Americans have lost their lives to COVID.   Millions are unemployed and so many are being evicted and losing their homes.  What world does Trump live in?https://t.co/pwpFjG3l3j

The Senate GOP is a day late & a dollar short. They delayed negotiations for months only to come up w/a paltry COVID package. One example: they propose COVID unemployment benefits of $300. That’s HALF of what we previously gave & HALF of what it should be. https://t.co/n7wgaWWymg

As we continue to face the COVID-19 pandemic it’s shined a light on the working people who have kept our country running by stocking grocery shelves working in hospitals and processing the food that ends up on our kitchen tables. (1/4)

Our public schools serve the majority of our nation’s students and need our support especially now. That’s why I am so alarmed to see private schools receive so much PPP funding. We must invest in our public schools in the next COVID-19 relief package. https://t.co/9uv4CPL6pS

Republicans shouldn’t leave students teachers and staff to fend for themselves during COVID. Democrats want to provide robust funding to help schools open safely and to increase access to virtual learning in the interim.   It’s time for Republicans to act!

Republicans waited until it was too late to begin negotiating a COVID package. Now the pandemic UI relief and other benefits have expired and Senate Republicans still don’t have a plan that can pass that chamber.

101 days.   That's how long it's been since the House passed the #HeroesAct which would extend the COVID unemployment benefits and more. It's time for @senatemajldr to act now. https://t.co/6CiPPj0dvL

This is why the Senate must pass the House's legislation which would support this industry through these challenging times and the families who need access to child care during COVID. https://t.co/sWE14FNaSr

During COVID 55% of Black women have less than $200 in savings and half can't afford basic needs like food or housing. This #BlackWomensEqualPay Day let's recommit to working towards justice with equal pay for equal work! #BlackWomenCantWait

The #HeroesAct would extend the COVID unemployment benefits and prevent Americans from experiencing the stress and uncertainty of losing their lifeline. Shame on @senatemajldr for letting it languish in the Senate for months.  https://t.co/Pcu8tRK9BZ

The resources that parents use to reunify with their children in foster care have been limited due to COVID.  My legislation would consider these changes by suspending the federal timeline used to terminate one's parental rights. https://t.co/TKQyMW6qFV

COVID has disrupted access to the resources that parents use to reunite w/their children in foster care. We must ensure that families have every opportunity to remain whole which is why I introduced the Suspend the Timeline Not Parental Rights During a Public Health Crisis Act.
Trump was warned of COVID-19 in January. https://t.co/O0f62QOQi4

The post office is important to our economy our communities and helps connect all of us but it's facing major challenges including new policies to slow the mail that may delay everything from medicines to ballots. We must fix this in the next COVID package.

As people continue to feel the pain from this health and economic crisis we need to ensure SNAP can keep helping people through these incredibly difficult times. We must include robust funding for SNAP and an extension of the COVID SNAP benefits in the next COVID relief package.

We need to expand access to child care so parents can safely return to work. That’s why I joined my colleagues in calling for the Child Care is Essential Act and the Child Care for Economic Recovery Act to be included in the next COVID relief package. https://t.co/cwKKFssUZp

We need investments in WI-04 especially during COVID to expand opportunity support our most vulnerable & to protect the health of our communities. I'm especially proud of the provisions I secured in the second @AppropsDems funding package to do this. https://t.co/ZgNvCbQO0U

Enough of the denial. Enough of the lies. Enough of the chaos and incompetence. More than 150000 Americans have died and the Trump administration still doesn’t have a coherent federal COVID-19 response plan. https://t.co/wnpTyilcwU

COVID-19 has devastated the child care sector forcing closures and exacerbating the shortage of quality affordable care. That’s why @HouseDemocrats are advancing two bills to provide relief for families and providers and support the safe reopening our economy. #SaveChildCare https://t.co/QFGR4GPoiD
The Senate GOP wants to spend $1.75 billion on a FBI building to help the Trump hotel across the street and at the same time wants to cut your COVID-19 unemployment insurance by 1/3.

Senate Republicans just began negotiating a COVID relief package and still haven’t finished! They went home for the weekend. What are they waiting on? People are hurting now and the pain will only continue! This could have been prevented. Our country deserves better.

The Trump administration has rejected additional funding for testing and contact tracing from Republicans as more than 140000 Americans have died from COVID-19. This is a horrible decision that is consistent with Trump's failed response to the pandemic. https://t.co/hPdqSxqVRM

At last week's @WaysMeansCmte hearing we examined the COVID-19 economic impact on #SocialSecurity that will cause harmful benefit cuts for workers turning 60 this year if Congress doesn’t act. I asked Mr. Richtman to speak to the urgency of taking action on this soon. https://t.co/wNCVw9u50q

The Trump administration is demanding schools reopen as states experience record COVID surges and schools lack the resources to *safely* reopen. We can't jeopardize the health and safety of our students teachers and personnel to satisfy Trump's petulant demands.
We need to secure high-quality care for all mothers during COVID and beyond. https://t.co/z9EIn67i3a

During COVID many community health centers are fighting to stay open and continue providing services in our communities. They need adequate funding now and I won't stop fighting until they receive it. https://t.co/Nk0XDmqpFG

COVID has been a magnifying glass further revealing the disparities which have impacted communities of color for decades. We must all work towards eliminating these inequities from our country.  https://t.co/E3fbMggekJ
Wear a mask! It not only protects you but it protects those around you. As we work to reopen masks along with physical distancing will be a crucial tool in preventing the spread of COVID-19.

The economic impact of COVID continues to be felt in the lives of children & their families. I highlighted during yesterday's @WaysMeansCmte hearing why measures like an expanded #CTC which is included in the #HeroesAct are essential to supporting families through these times. https://t.co/zeLh3Jwt00

Dreamers have been in limbo even as they serve in comunities & on the front lines of COVID. In light of the SCOTUS decision I joined my colleagues in calling on @senatemajldr to allow a vote on HR 6 which will secure permanent protections and a path to citizenship for Dreamers. https://t.co/vwbr0AUYjK

Community health centers provide care to the most vulnerable in our country including in Milwaukee. As many face financial struggles during COVID I will continue fighting to ensure they receive the funding necessary to continue serving in our communities.https://t.co/Nk0XDmqpFG

As a @HelsinkiComm Commissioner I am working to better understand how the pandemic impacts the most vulnerable around the world. I discussed COVID-19’s impact on vulnerable women including women in deep poverty refugees and migrants with the OSCE Parliamentary Assembly.

The Trump administration won't disclose where $500 billion of your taxpayer funds are going. Congress put in oversight provisions to make sure any COVID-19 relief didn’t line Trump and his rich friends' pockets. What is the Administration trying to hide? https://t.co/cUSd8vkCnD

Police violence is one of the most brutal elements of systemic racism but is not the only form. COVID has exposed how housing education environmental health and economic inequities can also take lives.

It's 2020. But still a dangerous poll tax emerged during COVID-19 that forced Wisconsinites to risk their health to exercise their right to vote.  We must ensure that in November voting is safe fair and accessible for everyone. https://t.co/k2sk0SBPpt

Wisconsin knows the perils of voter suppression all too well.  At 12 pm CT I am participating in the Committee on House Administration's Subcommittee on Elections hearing to discuss how COVID-19 has impacted voting rights.  Tune in here: https://t.co/lUlD0MfUFh

Our disputes with Iran's government should not stand in the way of our government helping innocent people weather a pandemic. I wrote a letter to @SecPompeo and @stevenmnuchin1 raising concerns that sanctions are preventing Iranian citizens from receiving needed COVID aid. https://t.co/HueeVVlhbh

During COVID I’ve worried about my sons wearing black masks. I bought white blue and beige masks so they wouldn’t look threatening.  They’re grown but I still carry deep anxieties whenever they leave the door.

A deeply sad and tragic day.  In this time of crisis when leadership was needed most Trump delayed downplayed and denied the dangers of COVID.  Now more than 100000 Americans have lost their lives.   A real travesty for our country. https://t.co/sXTCC8fcGv

During today’s @WaysMeansCmte hearing I touched on why culturally competent care is even more critical now.  And w/misinformation running rampant I appreciated the chance to discuss the myth of a Black gene that claims to make African Americans more susceptible to COVID. https://t.co/JoThHNZZQd

COVID-19 has highlighted the systemic inequities in our country. Watch as the @WaysMeansCmte holds a virtual hearing on the pandemic's disproportionate impact on communities of color. ⬇️https://t.co/gsbaTpKbAe
Through COVID-19 we have to continue looking out for each other. And we each have a role to play in keeping our communities safe. Care for your friends family and neighbors by wearing a mask.
Wisconsinites if you lost your job and your health care coverage during COVID-19 act now by visiting https://t.co/zf0KMW0Hi0 to find an affordable health insurance plan.

I joined my colleagues in pushing the President to extend funding to ensure the Wisconsin National Guard can continue fighting COVID-19 in our communities.   We cannot afford to move backwards in our pandemic response. https://t.co/lKjtVdDREH

President Trump was warned in January about COVID-19. He ignored the pandemic response plan left by the Obama administration. He downplayed its threat. His delayed response and continued incompetency remain an incredibly costly public danger. https://t.co/DHXjBC91vh
Why is @SecAzar so eager to return to normal knowing that Americans especially communities of color are still being infected and dying from COVID-19? https://t.co/B4A2UQ2aP2

Right now there is limited info about the impact of COVID-19 on pregnant people & their infants.   I led w/@RepBrianFitz in calling for more funding for the Surveillance for Emerging Threats to Mothers & Babies program to help us better care for our moms and children. https://t.co/COG9SbK5el

Breonna Taylor was an EMT on the front lines of COVID-19. Police entered her apartment on a drug warrant for a person that didn't live there. And no drugs were found in her apartment.   She was shot EIGHT times. Gross negligence can't be protected. There must be an investigation.

Wisconsinites your health and safety is important to me your family & our community. Please don’t delay seeking emergency care during COVID-19. Hospitals remain safe & clean for you to receive urgent care.  If you need other care or treatment contact your health care provider.
I'm joining the Southside Organizing Center now as a special guest on their online community forum to discuss the COVID-19 pandemic the election and the 2020 Census. Tune in: https://t.co/aFefwaTszz

Communities of color have been forced to bear the brunt of COVID-19 it’s why I’m proud to join @TheBlackCaucus @CAPAC the Native American Caucus & the @HispanicCaucus in a letter outlining our priorities to protect our workers small businesses & support our most vulnerable. https://t.co/MVHxVRcQ6W

Tomorrow at 3 pm I am hosting a town hall where I'll answer your stimulus check questions and you'll receive information on how to avoid COVID-19 scams. I hope you can join!  Register here: https://t.co/1gezdujePt

How can someone keep themselves healthy and safe during COVID-19 when they can't wash their hands?   We need a national moratorium on water electricity and broadband shutoffs in the #CARES2 bill to guarantee no one is denied access to the resources they need.

.@RepMarkPocan @SenatorBaldwin @RepRonKind and I called on @DHSgov & @fema to acknowledge the long-standing economic & health disparities being exacerbated in Milwaukee & around the country by COVID-19 to ensure their federal response meets the needs of vulnerable communities. https://t.co/X4Vtd7tZZK

59 years ago today 13 courageous Americans started a dangerous journey through the segregated south.   As COVID-19 magnifies the inequities in our country we must recommit to their fight for justice and equality. https://t.co/rvizPWLWCy

I’m alarmed that Patrick Cudahy plant employees had to work in close proximity to each other & reportedly weren’t provided masks until mid-April. And even as workers tested positive for COVID-19 the facility remained partially opened!  I’m demanding a thorough investigation. https://t.co/e0lP8ypcti

COVID-19 reminds us all that working people are the backbone of this country. Essential workers are helping us put food on the table keeping us healthy and safe and their working conditions must reflect these truths.

This #MinorityHealthMonth we cannot afford to ignore the long-standing disparities that leave communities of color at risk for COVID-19. We must prioritize access to health care resources and especially PPE and testing to marginalized communities. https://t.co/n6YJIPfkCV

Today I’m joining a town hall hosted by Wisconsin’s Legislative Black Caucus at 3pm to discuss the policies and initiatives we need to address the toll of COVID-19 on communities of color. https://t.co/bJlPB7wvhg
THREAD: The disproportionate outcomes of COVID-19 in Milwaukee and around the country demand action. (1/5) https://t.co/T9udzl2RKg

Too often our most vulnerable lack access to health care which is harmful during COVID-19. I’m pleased that members of our community who don't have a primary health care provider can receive COVID-19 testing through Community Health Centers in Milwaukee. https://t.co/DRmF75tM4J
We need more COVID-19 testing to safely return to normalcy. https://t.co/XwlnuhTTVN

A1: COVID-19 has strained the maternal health care system even more. Now hospitals are taking additional safety precautions which means many women will have less support in the delivery room. And right now there is an increased demand for midwives. #MaternalJustice (1/3) https://t.co/IxgwpiHBDs

I’ve known many who have lost their lives to COVID-19.   We need to commit resources to long-neglected communities of color. It’s the only way we can heal our communities from these tragedies and fully address the pandemic. https://t.co/BEkoCCFMnp

I'm working hard to ensure that state & local officials have resources to fight COVID-19 hospitals have testing supplies & personal protective equipment (PPE) small businesses have support families can afford to stay home & the most vulnerable don’t fall through the cracks.
Do you have questions about the stimulus checks or how to avoid COVID-19 scams that you would like answered in next week's town hall?  Submit here ⬇️⬇️https://t.co/JqSYXSESi0

Next Tuesday at 3pm I’m hosting a town hall discussion where I'll be answering your questions about the stimulus checks and Barbara Johnson Milwaukee’s Taxpayer Advocate will share tips on how to avoid COVID-19 scams.   Submit your questions here: https://t.co/JqSYXSWtGA https://t.co/Wp25PfjcQ7

The lack of crucial supplies needed to fight COVID-19 is straining hospitals & putting Wisconsinites and health care workers at risk. I'm working w/my colleagues to secure more testing supplies & personal protective equipment (PPE) for health care workers. https://t.co/yTtCQndeLd

Race-based pseudoscience has always been dangerous. These conspiracy theories are especially harmful when Black Americans are dying at alarming rates from COVID-19.   No race is immune.  Follow @CDCgov for the latest info. https://t.co/G37o9VMPH1
Our health centers play a critical role in tackling this pandemic by providing quality care to vulnerable Americans who are being disproportionately impacted by COVID-19.
No one is immune to COVID-19. Please stay home and practice social distancing. https://t.co/wTb0JLeCj5

Congress has taken important steps to mitigate the health and economic impact of the COVID-19 pandemic but it's becoming increasingly clear that swift & additional congressional action is necessary to address the impact on our workers & families. (2/2) https://t.co/RDn6y6AS1H

As the coronavirus has caused a blood shortage I am glad the @US_FDA eased restrictions for gay and bisexual men to donate blood. While this is a step in the right direction I will continue pushing for a lift of the discriminatory ban completely. https://t.co/J6a9fQkfck

The Indian Health Service serves more than 2 mil American Indians & Alaska Natives. They need resources for #CoronavirusIndianCountry now.  @HouseDemocrats secured more funding in the most recent relief package and we continue to fight to stop #Coronavirus in Indian Country. https://t.co/G0Cbrp36UP
WI-04: Are you looking for resources to help you and your family during the coronavirus pandemic? Visit a new page on my website to find information that can help: https://t.co/IywEDH0FEs

I remember a time not so long ago when @realDonaldTrump was concerned about politicians using coronavirus hysteria to push their policy objectives. While Dems wanted to help struggling families Trump just gave America's wealthiest polluters a free pass.  https://t.co/NHioSExjrH

.@HouseDemocrats’ new bill the Take Responsibility for Workers and Families Act will:  ✅ Help make health care more affordable by eliminating cost-sharing for coronavirus treatment  ✅ Increase access to affordable health care by creating a new open enrollment period  and more.
I’m taking a moment to thank our frontline heath care workers and first responders. I am so grateful for your tireless commitment to fighting the coronavirus pandemic.

I have reviewed the Senate’s draft COVID-19 response bill and it fails to meet the challenges we face.   It is mainly a corporate handout that leaves Americans vulnerable to both the economic and health consequences of COVID-19.

Our hospitals and doctors are overextended and millions of jobs are at risk. The Senate’s GOP proposal for the 3rd coronavirus response package fails to address the immediate needs of our health providers and Americans suffering.

My colleagues and I are urging @HHSgov to release funds to help Indian Country fight the Coronavirus pandemic. With a short medical supply the CDC needs to give the already approved funds to @IHSgov immediately. https://t.co/3BQ7PkKMZm

I’m heartbroken to learn that two Wisconsinites lost their lives to the coronavirus. Our health care workers & public health officials are working tirelessly to keep our communities safe. Our state & country will work through these difficult times together.https://t.co/btnSl2NSt6

I'm pleased that the Senate finally passed the #FamiliesFirst Coronavirus Response Act. The President must now swiftly sign this legislation into law. The American people are waiting. https://t.co/lcrfusCtKm

Update: @USCIS announced they will NOT consider #coronavirus testing or treatment in a #PublicCharge evaluation. Our immigrant brothers and sisters can seek the care they need without fear. https://t.co/kTV4EhGVfb
If you have questions or would like to receive more information on the coronavirus contact the City of Milwaukee’s Health Dept at 414-286-3521.

The economic reality many Americans face is why I joined the House in passing the Families First Coronavirus Response Act early Saturday which would guarantee free testing strengthen unemployment benefits and provide paid leave. (4/5)

Last night I was informed that someone I came into contact with on March 8th tested positive for COVID-19. I didn't physically contact this individual and I consulted with the Office of the Attending Physician who informed me that my risk for contracting COVID-19 is low. (1/5) https://t.co/uYweLvj18k

Last night I supported the House's passage of the #FamiliesFirst Coronavirus Response Act. We'll keep working to address this crisis and ensure that Americans and state local & tribal officials have access to the resources necessary to protect our communities. Full statement: https://t.co/8irDprJbCy

As we work to reduce the spread of coronavirus in our communities I applaud this decision. It will help ensure that any WI resident facing a financial struggle won't become more vulnerable and unable to practice important preventative measures. https://t.co/rBHdVkzPYg

There are two confirmed coronavirus cases in Milwaukee County. I am monitoring the situation closely and will continue working with local state and federal government partners to ensure that our communities have the resources they need. https://t.co/qYaguPCQdC

Today the House will vote on our next coronavirus response legislation to provide Americans w/paid family and medical leave increased federal Medicaid funds to support our state public health partners free testing & emergency sick leave for those impacted by the virus. (2/3)

.@HouseDemocrats’ #FamiliesFirst #Coronavirus Response Act expands food assistance:  ✅$500M to help low-income pregnant women or mothers with young children ✅$400M to help local food banks ✅ $250M to provide home-delivered and pre-packaged meals to low-income seniors https://t.co/329hJkarAp

The House is expected to take action soon on its 2nd robust coronavirus package to help state and local governments businesses & individuals impacted by the coronavirus. I'll keep working w/govt partners at the federal state & local levels to keep Wisconsinites safe & healthy.

Americans need a fully-funded coordinated government-wide response to stay safe against the #coronavirus.   I proudly supported the passage of legislation that will provide $8.3 billion in funding to fully address this public health emergency & protect the American people. https://t.co/oWhDDwf1mD
Stay informed about the coronavirus ⬇️ https://t.co/AMGmQDJNaX
